body:
`Executable` looks for arguments that contain quotes and issues a warning if found; but for some internal cases (e.g., running an embedded script with `-c`) quotes are necessary, but still generate warning messages to the end-user.

This adds a `_warn_quotes` kwarg to `Executable.__call__` so that the caller can intentionally opt-out of warnings.
title: Don't show warnings for quotes during environment inspection
